title: aimotion -- logo for a symposium
content:
Hello typophiles,

This is my first post in the critique section. I recently made this logo for an Artificial Intelligence symposium at the Radboud University in Nijmegen, The Netherlands. I'm pleased with it, it portrays the "motion" aspect well I think. Please tell me what you think.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [aimotion.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108201938/http:/typophile.com/files/aimotion.png) | 10.22 KB |
author: Wouter Spaak

comments.content: Exagerate the expanding spacing in motion so its obvious, otherwise nice work!

Try to balance the spacing between the flying squares so those on the top (they separate from the static ones quite abruptly) relate to those on the bottom (they get too close there, and may cause some visual noise).  
I like it a lot, it gets the motion feeling just right, not forgetting the "tech" aspect of ai.  
Nice work!

Nice idea. A bit too complex for my taste, though. Can you lose elements and squares without losing the overall feel?

----------------------------------------------------  
My work is a game. A very serious game [M.C. Escher]

While I like the concept, I find that the use of different widths for the two grid structures is problematic. I also feel the lower grid is too tight on 'BNAIS 2005'. Perhaps the lower grid is not necessary?
